text: Fill 2 (4-ounce) Martini glasses with ice water and let stand 1 minute (to chill glasses).
Reduce heat to medium and simmer uncovered until juices are thick, stirring gently and frequently to prevent burning, about 20 minutes.
Serve at room temperature.
In a tall glass filled with ice cubes combine the tequila, the cranberry juice and the apple juice and top off the drink with the club soda.
Combine the apples, water, and lemon juice in an 8 x 8-inch baking pan.
Add shrimp and cook, stirring, 1 minute.
Season the pesto with pepper.
Mound the beans in the center, and decorate base with groups of marinated mushrooms and zucchini interspersed with hard-boiled eggs, tomatoes, olives, anchovies, chunks of tuna or other fish.
Grate the fresh nutmeg over the drink.
Combine water, tea bags, rind, and mint leaves in a glass pitcher and set in sun for 6 to 8 hours.
Prepare just as for the master recipe, #284, adding the raisins when you would have added the cherries.
Combine the mayonnaise, mustard, lemon juice, and pepper in a small saucepan and heat gently.
Drain the couscous, return it to the pot, and toss with the butter, parsley, and a pinch of pepper.
Stir in the cheese.
Shake it up and pour into 2 highball glasses filled with ice.
Grill chicken on an oiled rack 4 inches above glowing coals 5 minutes on each side, or until cooked through.
Marinate kidney beans, zucchini, and mushrooms in vinaigrette for 20 to 30 minutes.
In a small bowl, stir ingredients with a fork until thoroughly combined.
Blanch cut-up veggies in boiling salted water; cool under cold water and thread on skewers.
Using your chopping bowl and chopper, chop together all the ingredients.
Shape into a log by rolling in parchment paper or plastic wrap.
It wont be as green, but it will taste just fine.
Blend milk in a blender in 2 batches until frothy (use caution when blending hot liquids).
Twist lemon peel directly over drink to release essential oils, garnish with green olive, and serve.
Combine the potatoes, onion, celery, pickles, relish, and chopped eggs.
Serve with chips, crackers, or flour tortillas.
Boil water, sugar, juniper berries, rosemary, and a pinch of salt in a small saucepan, stirring until sugar has dissolved, until reduced to about 3/4 cup, 10 to 12 minutes.
Fluff the couscous with a fork.
Toast the nuts in a small skillet over medium heat.
In a blender blend all ingredients with 1 cup ice cubes until completely smooth.
Float the Galliano on top and garnish with orange slice
Bring a large pot of heavily salted water to a boil over high heat.
Sprinkle with salt and pepper.
Increase heat to medium-high and stir in butter and peas, then cook, covered, stirring occasionally, until peas are tender, about 8 minutes.
Combine all of the ingredients in a small bowl and serve within 2 to 3 hours.
Add water and broth and bring to a boil.
After wheat berries have been cooking 45 minutes, cook onion in butter and oil in a heavy skillet over moderate heat, stirring, until softened, about 6 minutes.
Taste for sweetness and add more sugar, if desired.
For the sauce, in a small saucepan stir together the soup and cream and heat until bubbly.
The sauce will keep for 1 week in a tightly sealed container in the refrigerator.
Stir well.
Cook the swordfish as you would the chops but cook for 1 minute less on each side.
Drop heaping 1/4 cups of batter about 1 inch apart on an ungreased large baking sheet.
Serve with creme fraiche, nuts, and fruit.
In mixing glass or cocktail shaker filled with ice, combine gin, vermouth, bitters, and simple syrup.

In a 2-quart microwave-safe casserole with a lid microwave the beets with the water, covered, at high power (100%), stirring every 2 minutes, for 6 to 15 minutes, or until they are tender when pierced with a fork, transferring them as they are cooked to a cutting board, and let them cool.
Top the whole or sliced chicken breasts with the raisin sauce and the buttered, toasted almonds, then serve with salad and potatoes or bread.
Serve the salsa with tortilla chips or with grilled meat or fish.
Combine cucumbers, tomatoes, scallions, olives, half of feta, and mint in a large bowl.
Transfer the filling to a pastry bag fitted with a large decorative tip and pipe it into the egg whites, mounding it.
Blend pineapple, water, lime juice, and sugar in a blender until very smooth.
Add tomatoes, scallion, and herbs, then stir-fry 3 minutes.
Add the Sherry and cook over medium heat for 3 minutes.
The apples and almonds should be about the size of the chunks in chunky peanut butter.
Peel the beets and slice them.
Prepare just as for the master recipe, #60, but when you begin the rice, melt the butter in the saucepan, saute the garlic for 1 minute before adding the water.

Trim the narrow end of each radish half so that the half will stand upright and with a small melon-ball cutter hollow out a 3/4-inch cavity in each half, dropping the halves as they are hollowed into a bowl of ice and cold water.

Microwave the mixture at high power, stirring after 1 minute, for 2 minutes, or until the mixture is thickened, stir in the beets and the butter, and microwave the mixture at high power for 1 minute, or until the beets are heated through.
Add remaining ingredients and mix well.
Uncover and bake until top is well-browned and most of stock is absorbed, 30 to 35 minutes more.
Cover tightly with foil and bake 30 minutes.
Stir in mint just before serving.
Turn wrapped tomato on its side and tie salami with a chive just below gathers (handle chive gently so it won't break), leaving top of tomato exposed.
Cut the cream cheese into small pieces.
Macerate until completely cooled, about 30 minutes.
Just before serving, top the eggs with the caviar.
Combine potatoes, milk, garlic, bay leaf, thyme, salt, and pepper in a 1- to 1 1/2-quart heavy saucepan and bring to a simmer, stirring.
It will not keep for longer than about 6 weeks unless stored in the refrigerator.
In a bowl whisk together vinegar, mustard mixture, salt, and pepper and add oil in a stream, whisking until emulsified.
Whisk together oil and vinegar and pour over salad.
Stir together flour, baking powder, salt, and sugar in a large bowl.
Pour the mixture into a buttered 2-quart baking dish and bake at 325 degrees for 1 hour.
Press 1 tomato, stemmed end down, into cheese (to stabilize it), then gather salami up around tomato.
Simple Syrup can be kept in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 1 month.
Spread the topping in an even layer over the apples and bake for 45 to 55 minutes, or until the topping is crisp and browned.
Just before serving, halve the remaining 4 eggs and place them on the salad as decoration.
At serving time, toss mixed salad greens in a bowl with vinaigrette and arrange around the edges of a large serving dish.
In a bowl cream the cream cheese, stir in the olives, the capers, the minced parsley, and salt and pepper to taste, and transfer the mixture to a pastry bag fitted with a 1/2-inch plain tip.
Transfer squash to bowl.
If the sausage pieces are to be served as a tapas, spear them with toothpicks.
Stir together butter, feta, mint, and a rounded 1/2 teaspoon salt in a large bowl.
Split the cucumbers in half and use a melon baller or teaspoon to scoop out the seeds.
Add 1 tablespoon butter to the toasted nuts; melt and toss to coat.
In a food processor chop fine the garlic, the lime, the scallions, and the chili, add the lime juice, the tomatoes, the oil, and the coriander, and puree the mixture.
Cook over medium heat about 30 minutes, until tomatoes are tender.
Add ham to skillet with sugar paste still clinging and saute until brown and heated through, about 3 minutes per side.
Taste and add salt or vinegar, as needed.
Stir limeade and serve immediately over ice.
Heat oil in a 2-quart saucepan over moderately high heat until hot but not smoking and brown neck and giblets.
Bring the water and vinegar to the boil with the salt and pour over the vegetables.
Add plums, ice, water, and sugar and blend until plums are pureed, about 15 seconds.
Stir in remaining ingredients and zest, then let stand, covered, at room temperature 15 minutes (to allow flavors to develop).
Serve sprinkled with parsley.
Combine sugar and water in a saucepan and cook over low heat, stirring constantly until the sugar is dissolved.
Slice and serve.
Peel potatoes and thinly slice (about 1/16 inch thick), then toss with butter, 3/4 teaspoon salt, and 1/2 teaspoon pepper.
In a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes, combine the vodka and orange juice.
Keep refrigerated.)
Serve the relish at room temperature with pita wedges.
In a large bowl, combine the chicken, breadcrumbs, rice, milk, pimentos, salt, and cayenne.
Place four 12-ounce glasses in freezer for 1 hour.
Flip the cakes and panfry the other side until golden brown.
Prepare an ice bath, and set aside.
Cook as directed.
Stir in couscous, then cover and remove from heat.
Lower the heat to medium and cook for 15 minutes, or until the potatoes are soft and the water almost gone.
Cover and cook gently until the onions are very soft and tender, about 5 minutes.
The relish may be made 3 days in advance and kept covered and chilled.
Add cream, then stir just until a dough forms.
Whisk together vinegar, mustard, salt, pepper, and shallot in a bowl, then add oil in a slow stream, whisking until emulsified.
Add the mushrooms, onions, almonds, garlic, and lemon juice, and saute gently for about 10 minutes.
Rub the chicken with the remaining 1 teaspoon oil, the lemon juice, and salt and pepper to taste and arrange it, skin side up, on top of the vegetable mixture.
Top with plums and marinating liquid.
Add the radicchio and chicory; saute until slightly wilted, 1 to 2 minutes.
Combine first four ingredients in bowl.
Place onions on the grill and cover.
Chill the truffles on a baking sheet lined with waxed paper for 30 minutes, or until they are firm.
Heat the oil over medium-high heat, add the crab cakes (in batches), and fry until browned, 3 to 5 minutes.
Add cold rice, salt, and pepper, then stir-fry, pressing on rice to break up any lumps, 2 minutes.
Whisk sugar and lime juice in small bowl to form paste; rub over both sides of ham steak.
Steam the vegetables for 10 minutes, or until tender.
Pour the peanut oil into a large skillet and set aside.
Pour dressing over salad; toss to coat.
In a metal bowl set over a pan of barely simmering water melt the chocolate, stirring until it is smooth, remove the bowl from the pan, and let the chocolate cool slightly.
Discard the bay leaves and serve immediately.
Slice into thin rounds and use as needed.
Serve Margarita garnished with lime slice in a stemmed glass.
Discard bay leaf and transfer to a large bowl.
Pour through a very fine sieve into a pitcher, pressing on solids.
Reduce heat to low and gently simmer, partially covered, stirring occasionally, until potatoes are very tender, about 10 minutes.
Just before it begins to run, remove the dish and carry it to the table.
When you remove the sauce from the heat and add the butter, add the capers and parsley, too.
Using electric mixer, beat cream cheese and butter in large bowl until fluffy.
Prepare just as for the master recipe, #343, adding the raisins and pine nuts at the same time you add the chicken stock and lemon juice to the sausage and onions.
The stuffed eggs may be made 1 day in advance and kept covered and chilled.
Whisk together sour cream, mayonnaise, zest, lemon juice, sugar, water, salt, and pepper in a large bowl until sugar is dissolved.
Spoon sorbet into balloon glasses.
With the processor running, add the oil in a slow, steady stream; process until smooth.
Divide among 4 glasses.
Stir in gin.
Boil water, add ingredients and steep for 5 minutes.)
Sprinkle the pasta with any or all of the suggested toppings, as desired, and serve immediately.
Stir in the soup and bring to a boil.
Cook over medium-low heat until heated through.
Stir coleslaw, horseradish and thyme in small bowl to blend.
Shake together gin, vermouth, and ice cubes in cocktail shaker, then strain into glasses.
Add the sugar and water and blend until smooth.
In a bowl, combine the oats, flour, sugar, and cinnamon.
Place ham on plate and refrigerate at least 1 hour and up to 3 hours (paste may liquefy).
Whisk together the ketchup, chipotle, salt, and pepper in a small bowl.
Make about 1 cup.

Stir in the butter and cook for 3 minutes longer, then stir in the shrimp, vegetables, bay leaves, cayenne, paprika, and salt, increase the heat to high, and cook, stirring occasionally, until the shrimp are just pink, about 5 minutes.
In a large ovenproof skillet toss together the shallots, the garlic, 2 tablespoons of the oil, the bell peppers, the chopped rosemary, the potatoes, and salt and pepper to taste.
Cover and refrigerate at least 2 and up to 4 hours.
Trim ends of both lemons, then stand lemons on a cut side and cut peel, including all white pith, from lemons with a sharp paring knife (discard peel).
Stir until sugar dissolves.
Combine all of the remaining ingredients and shape into 10 crab cakes.
Drizzle each with some Strawberry Syrup, garnish with strawberry, if desired, and serve with spoon and straw.
Beat in orange juice concentrate and vanilla.
Then return the glaze to the heat and stand back as it will flame up if you are using a gas burner.
Beat the egg yolks well until they turn light in color, adding 1/2 cup of the sugar as you beat.
Saute garlic for 2 to 3 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper, and add some of the reserved pasta water as desired.
Add powdered sugar 1/2 cup (scant) at a time, beating well after each addition.
Refrigerate until well chilled.
Add the cucumbers to the bowl and toss well to mix.
Add cumin and cook, stirring, 1 minute.
Add oil, garlic, chile, and ginger, then stir-fry 15 seconds.
In a 12-inch skillet bring water and soy sauce with garlic to a boil.
Add the anchovies, and cook 1 minute.

Combine the sweetened condensed milk, grapefruit juice, salt, citric acid, and food coloring in a medium bowl and mix with a rubber spatula by stirring and folding over the mixture until it is homogenous.
For dressing, mix oil, lemon juice, red pepper, and garlic; season with salt and drizzle over veggies.
Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate at least 4 hours before serving, or better yet, chill overnight.
Season with salt and pepper and serve immediately.
Stir in the dill.
Brown on grill or under broiler.
Puree zucchini, cucumber, onion, vinegar, water, chile, 1 teaspoon salt, and 1/2 teaspoon coriander in a blender until very smooth.
Zest the lemon directly into a blender or food processor, then add the cream cheese, sour cream, half-and-half, sugar, and salt, and puree until smooth.
Whisk in chili sauce, watercress, and bacon.
Chill, covered, 1 hour to allow flavors to develop.
Cover and chill until cold, at least 2 hours.
Make more "blossoms" in same manner, then trim chives.
Add tuna and capers to hot potato mixture, then beat with an electric mixer at low speed, adding oil in a slow stream, until potatoes and tuna are broken up but not smooth and oil is incorporated.
Garnish each drink with a couple of cherries.
In a bowl stir together the orange sections, the onion, the olives, the oil, the vinegar, the cumin, and salt and pepper to taste, add the romaine, and toss the salad well.
Sprinkle over hot popcorn in a large bowl and toss to coat.
Chill the mixture thoroughly in the refrigerator, then freeze it in your ice cream maker according to the manufacturers instructions.
Taste for seasoning.
Strain into a cocktail glass.
Stir together cheese and basil until combined well.
Toss lemon segments gently with sugar in a bowl.
Chill until firm enough to spread, about 30 minutes.
Add broccoli rabe and cook, covered, over moderately high heat 2 minutes.
Put blueberries in a heatproof bowl and strain syrup through a sieve over berries.
In a blender, puree 1/2 cup of the yogurt with the cilantro, sugar, and salt until smooth and bright green.
The pesto can be refrigerated, covered by a thin layer of olive oil in an airtight container, up to 1 week.
For hummus, blend ingredients; season with salt, pepper, and bottled hot sauce.
Place all ingredients in heavy large pot.
Stir in raisins, vinegar, water, red pepper flakes, coriander, and salt and simmer 2 minutes.
Bring to boil over medium-high heat, stirring until sugar dissolves.
Raise the heat slightly and cook, uncovered, until the liquid is syrupy, about 15 minutes.
Stir all the ingredients together in a small mixing bowl.
This is very good served with chicken or beef.
Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
In an electric spice grinder or blender grind fine coriander seeds, bay leaves, peppercorns, and cloves.
Add all the remaining ingredients and mix well with a wooden spoon.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld.
Skim off and discard any fat.
Heat a wok or 12-inch nonstick skillet over high heat until hot.
Add garlic and cook, stirring, 30 seconds.
Whisk oil and lemon juice in a small bowl; season dressing with salt and pepper.
Form heaping teaspoons of the mixture into balls and roll the balls in the cocoa powder.
Melt butter in medium skillet over medium heat.
Stir together all ingredients in a pitcher until sugar is dissolved, then add about 2 cups ice cubes and stir until very cold.
Season with salt.
The radishes may be stuffed 1 1/2 hours in advance and kept covered and chilled.
Add the prunes and the Armagnac and simmer the mixture, covered, for 15 minutes.
Add the ginger ale and serve at once in 8-ounce goblets.
Stir together all ingredients in a bowl.
Drop in the snow peas and cook until barely tender, drain, and return to pan.
In a small heavy saucepan cook the carrot in the oil over moderate heat, stirring, for 1 minute.
In a large pot of boiling salted water, cook the rigatoni until al dente according to the package directions; drain, reserving 1/2 cup of the cooking water.
Add all remaining ingredients and blend until smooth.
Combine all ingredients in a mixing glass and shake well.
Use immediately, or transfer to an airtight container and store in the fridge for up to 2 weeks.
Stir in coriander.
Whisk together mustard, shallot, sugar, salt, pepper, and vinegar in a small bowl, then add oil in a slow stream, whisking until emulsified.
Reduce heat to low; cover and cook 20 minutes Discard cilantro before serving.
Stir in wheat berries, kosher salt, pepper, and pecans.
Use lettuce leaves to roll up steak slices with the other ingredients.
Use a rubber spatula to combine well.
Blend lime wedges (including peel) in a blender on high speed 10 seconds.
Put the potatoes and water in a large stockpot and bring to a boil over high heat.
Divide the lettuce wedges between 2 plates, spoon the dressing over them, and sprinkle the salads with the radishes.
Refrigerate plum mixture at least 20 minutes.
Finely grate enough zest from 1 lemon to measure 2 teaspoons.
In a medium-sized mixing bowl, stir together all the ingredients except the salt and pepper until thoroughly mixed.
Add cream, parsley, and Parmesan cheese last.
Add remaining ingredients and simmer until reduced to about 4 cups, 40 to 45 minutes.
Sprinkle remaining half of feta over and serve.
Transfer to a bowl and cool completely.
Cool.
Toss with sliced garlic, thyme, and extra-virgin olive oil; season with kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper.
(For the freshest taste, serve this sauce within 1 hour.)
Stir in beans and orange juice and cook until beans are heated through and most liquid is evaporated.
Let couscous stand, covered, 5 minutes, then fluff with a fork and stir in herbs, lemon juice, remaining tablespoon oil, and salt and pepper to taste.
Stir cabbage, carrot, and scallion into dressing and season with salt and pepper.
Blend on low speed while slowly drizzling in the olive oil.
Place alternating slices of tomatoes, zucchini and onion on serving platter.
In a bowl whisk together zest, lemon juice, and honey until combined well and whisk in buttermilk, yogurt, oil, vanilla, and a pinch of salt.
Put all ingredients into a sealable airtight container and shake until combined well.
Sprinkle with herbs.
Chill for several hours.
Divide coffee among 8 large cups and top off with hot milk.
Let the relish stand, covered and chilled, overnight.
Set aside at room temperature until ready to serve.
Keep chilled and completely covered in oil.
Add brown sugar; beat until well blended.
Cut segments free from membranes, then cut segments crosswise into 1/4-inch pieces.
Whisk together ginger, tamari soy sauce, lemon zest, lemon juice, and sesame oil in a small bowl.
Spread bread with a thick layer of French mustard, then cover the whole surface of the bread with strips of cheese.
Heat the oil in a skillet over medium heat and brown the sausage pieces on all sides, about 5 minutes.
Fold in the chicken, water chestnuts, and cheese.
Always use clean spoon to remove garlic.
Whisk remaining 3/4 teaspoon salt and 1/2 teaspoon coriander into crme frache.
Dust the salad with chopped parsley and serve at once.

Roast the chicken and the vegetables in the upper third of a preheated 450F oven for 20 minutes, reduce the temperature to 357F., and roast the chicken and the vegetables for 15 minutes more, or until the chicken is cooked through and the potatoes are tender.
Just before serving, toss salad ingredients with just enough vinaigrette to coat and season with salt and pepper.
Put hot sliced beef on a platter surrounded by the cilantro, tomato, avocado, green onions, carrots, jicama, peanuts, and limes.
Cook onion in 1 tablespoon oil in a 2- to 3-quart heavy saucepan over moderate heat, stirring occasionally, until golden, about 3 minutes.
Fill 6 tumblers with ice and pour 2 tablespoons vodka into each.
Stir together salt and spices in a small bowl.
Season broccoli rabe with salt.
Add the Chambord by tilting the glass and slowly pouring it down the side of the glass (as you would a beer).
Stir together the ingredients in a small bowl.
Stem, core, and quarter bell peppers; place on a baking sheet.
Cook, stirring occasionally, until sugar has completely dissolved.
Add cabbage, carrots, scallions, and parsley and toss well.
Preheat oven to 400F.

Scrub the cucumbers well and pack them in a 2-quart glass jar with the whole garlic cloves, celery leaves, sprigs of dill, or dill seed, peppercorns, and coriander seeds distributed at regular intervals.
Strain the liquid through a sieve over the chicken and garnish the chicken with the rosemary sprigs.
Discard ice water and dry glasses.

Place the butter, garlic, parsley, scallion, thyme, chives, salt, and pepper in a food processor or blender and pulse until well combined and blended, stopping to scrape down the bowl several times as you go.
Serve soup topped with dollops of crme frache.
Bring water, onion, and 1/2 teaspoon salt to a boil in a heavy medium saucepan, then cook over medium heat, covered, stirring occasionally, until onion is tender, about 5 minutes.
Remove the pan from the heat, stir in the vanilla, and set the pan in a bowl of ice and cold water, stirring the mixture every few minutes until it is thick and cold.
In a small bowl beat the cream until it just holds stiff peaks and fold the coffee mixture into it gently but thoroughly.
Transfer with tongs to butter mixture and toss until well coated.
Combine the sugar syrup with the fruit juices and pour over ice cubes in a punch bowl.
Transfer butterscotch to bowl.
Refrigerate in an airtight container for up to 3 days.
Melt butter in a saucepan.
Then beat the egg whites with the remaining sugar until they peak.
Chill the mixture thoroughly, then freeze it in your ice cream maker according to the manufacturers instructions.
In a medium saucepan, bring the sugar and water to a boil over medium-high heat.
Add second pint of ice cream and puree until almost smooth.
Bake in middle of oven until tops are pale golden and bottoms are golden brown, 18 to 20 minutes.
Force the yolks through a sieve into a bowl and stir in the mayonnaise, the sour cream, the lemon juice, and salt and pepper to taste.
Serve warm over broiled fish.
Cook onion in oil in a small heavy skillet over moderate heat, stirring, until pale golden.
Cut the kiwifruits into chunks and puree them in a blender or food processor (youll should have 2 cups, or 500 ml, of puree).
Cover the pan, remove it from the heat, and let the couscous stand for 5 minutes.
Arrange skin side down in a single layer and roast in a 425F oven until softened, then top with Parmesan and broil until cheese is melted and peppers are slightly charred.
Toss all the ingredients except the lettuce together in a large bowl.
Let the mixture cool completely, covered.
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.
